intro: Mentzelia obscura, commonly known as the dark mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and grasslands. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish, with five petals and a distinctive, tubular shape. Mentzelia obscura is part of the Loasaceae family and is known for its adaptability to harsh, dry conditions.
